description: Demonhives once existed only on one layer of the Abyss, but they have since spread to other layers, as well as other planes, through gates and deliberate transfers by fi ends interested in causing havoc. Such transplants tend to be short-lived in the Upper Planes, where inhabitants take pains to eradicate the threat, but the Material Plane offers a pleasant environment for demonhives to thrive. Demonhives can exist in any temperate and warm lands, but they are most successful in forests and jungles. With no protection from the elements but their hives and hides, demonhive members fi nd cold lands inhospitable.
name: Environment

description: Dwarf ancestors are nearly always faithful, because they were heroes who protect those in found in underground complexes, forming the last need. Many were themselves killed in battle and welcome line of defense for a community. Royal halls, ancestral the opportunity to fi ght once more against their people’s homes, and temples are some of the places most likely enemies. Their stony bodies suffer no pain, and they can to be guarded by a dwarf ancestor, although some dwarf fi ght to utter destruction without fear, since they return to priests can summon these champions of Moradin into Moradin’s hall at the end of the battle. other battles for a short time. name: Environment

description: Lunar rav- agers stand just over 9 feet tall, on average, and weigh in the neighborhood of 550 pounds. Their skin is fair, though females tend toward pale, and their hair is always blond.
name: Typical Physical Characteristics

description: Necrosis carnexes can be found wherever their abilities are needed. They have no native environment, though they often share the habitats of intelligent undead.
name: Environment

description: Every necrosis carnex is different, because each one is cobbled together from several corpses. It might walk on four hands, or have no arms at all. Each unholy creation is held together by cold iron bands.
name: Typical Physical Characteristics
